name: Glamping at Parkwood Outdoors, Dolygaer
what_makes_it_unique: Situated on the edge of the Pontsticill Reservoir with stunning views and access to adventure activities like kayaking and gorge walking directly on site.

name: Aber Glamping
what_makes_it_unique: Stay in a geodesic dome or bell tent set in a wildflower meadow with panoramic views of the Black Mountains. Features a communal kitchen and fire pit area.

name: Woodland Park Glamping
what_makes_it_unique: Eco-friendly glamping pods nestled in ancient woodland, perfect for nature lovers seeking tranquility. Each pod has its own private decking area.

name: Beacons Bluff Escapes
what_makes_it_unique: Lakeside cabins with direct access to Llangorse Lake for wild swimming and kayaking. Offers stunning sunset views over the water.

name: Camp Cynrig Glamping Village
what_makes_it_unique: A unique tipi village and cabin set in a quiet spot by the river Cynrig, offering a true off-grid experience with solar lighting and composting toilets.

name: Coity Bach Farm Glamping
what_makes_it_unique: Traditional gypsy caravans and pods on a working farm, offering a nostalgic and rustic stay. Guests can meet the farm animals.

name: Argoed Barns
what_makes_it_unique: A luxury shepherd's hut with a hot tub, set in a peaceful location with panoramic views of the Brecon Beacons. Ideal for romantic getaways.

name: Toad and Snail Glamping
what_makes_it_unique: Stay in a lovingly restored GWR brake van for a truly unique railway-themed accommodation experience. Includes a private wood-fired hot tub.

name: Cantref Adventure Farm
what_makes_it_unique: Camping pods located on a popular adventure farm, offering free entry to the farm park for guests. Great for families with young children.

name: Dan-yr-Ogof Showcaves Campsite
what_makes_it_unique: Camping and caravanning site located at the National Showcaves Centre for Wales, surrounded by over 200 life-sized dinosaur models.
